V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• It was discussed the length of time youth are in detention since there is a

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
2

Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The facility was successful in following through on their actions to correct the issues
found in their last inspection. There were no late reports found during this
inspection.

N/A

Staff and Youth Interviews
All levels of staff interviewed report there have been some struggles with the
change in administration, but all feel supported and that efforts have been
successful in adapting to the new Director. The staff feel supported by
administration in all areas. The new Director reported a strong desire to enable staff
to perform at their best in providing supervision and support for the youth.
All youth interviewed reported feeling safe and having staff supervise them
appropriately. They report restraints are minimal and done appropriately. Their only
concern is the length of time youth spend in detention because of the shortage of
treatment facilities.
Description of Agency Walk Through
This is a single-level facility well maintained in all aspects. The facility is well
furnished, and all aspects of the licensing rules are met. The appropriate items are
posted in the appropriate locations.
3

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
